snippet: The United States said the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah has trained and advised government forces inside Syria and has helped to expel opposition fighters from within the country.
abstract: United States accuses the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah of deep involvement in the Syrian government’s violent campaign to crush the uprising there; asserts that Hezbollah has trained and advised government forces inside Syria and has helped to expel opposition fighters from areas within the country; accusations, which went beyond previous American charges about Hezbollah support for Syria’s government, seemed intended to counter critics who say the Obama administration has not done enough to stop the violence.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Scott Shane contributed reporting from Washington, Damien Cave from Istanbul, and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: The United States said the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah has trained and advised government forces inside Syria and has helped to expel opposition fighters from within the country.

headline.main: U.S. Accuses Hezbollah of Aiding Syria’s Crackdown
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Say Hezbollah Helps Syria’s Military

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
